title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Thursday 8 June 2017 - BBC News
summary: voting under way across the region .
how festival drug tests prompted one in five to ditch their fix .
news camera crews in kendal polling station scuffle .
horse fair opens with high water threatening river washing tradition .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 've now finished posting news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and other nuggets for today .
here are some of the main points :
we 'll be here through the night to keep you up to date with the election results as they come in , and through tomorrow with any remaining results , and reactions .
if you have a photograph you 'd like to share , or you have news you think we should know , you can email us , tweet , or get in touch through our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: man , 34 , badly hurt in barrow assault
text: police say they 're trying to gather information an attack in barrow which left a man with a serious head injury .
the assault happened at the junction of william street and cavendish street at about 04:30 on sunday , and detectives have just appealed for witnesses .
the victim , who 's 36 and from middlesbrough , is still in the royal preston hospital .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : a clear night with showers later
text: it should be a mild night with clear and dry spells but also more showers , which could become frequent and heavy in the early hours .
minimum temperature 11c ( 52f ) .
you can find the latest weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: paul 's smile as england youngsters bowl over italy for place in final
text: paul simpson , the former carlisle manager , has seen his england under-20 through to the world cup final with a 3-1 win over italy in south korea .
they meet venezuela on sunday .
author: BBC Radio Cumbria Sport

documents.title: appleby caravan numbers 'slightly down ' as fair rolls in
text: the numbers of gypsies and travellers at appleby fair are slightly down this year on last , according to the co-ordinating group .
dr robin hooper , who chairs the group , said there were 118 horse-drawn bowtops and 375 modern caravans on fair hill , compared to 375 caravans and 119 bowtops at the same time last year .
local people have mixed views about the fair : local businesses often make a large part of their annual profit during the event , but other appleby residents stay in their homes or stay elsewhere .
if we 've got nice weather for the fair it can be four or five-fold for the takings . ''

documents.title: hannah lets the landscape speak through her poems
text: hannah fraser and her husband rob make a country living in and around the southern lake district , helping local farmers and writing .
this morning hannah featured on farming today on bbc radio 4 and you can hear her reading one of her poems here .
author: Caz Graham
Reporter

documents.title: 'reassurance ' brings armed police patrols to appleby
text: the police operation for appleby fair will include more visibly armed officers than usual this year , but the officers in command say it 's not because of any specific threat to the event .

temporary chief supt mark pannone says : `` we have increased certain patrols , and we have increased armed patrols but that 's not because of appleby itself , it 's supporting the wider national reassurance campaign that 's going on . ''

documents.title: horses get traditional appleby wash as clouds loom again
text: one of the big attractions at appleby fair is watching gypsies washing the horses they 're hoping to sell , in the river eden .

but with the river levels higher than usual , the authorities have closed access to the water once and threatened to do it again since , so police are keeping a cautious eye on proceedings ( and do tell us if they really did a sun dance !
the river access remains open however the rain is back ⛆ # doasundance # applebyfair
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: carlisle 'closer to first signings '
text: carlisle 'closer to first signings '

documents.title: power firm puts the lights back on for 16,000
text: electricity north west says it 's dealt with power cuts affecting 16,000 customers across the north west as unseasonally high winds have affected the region this week .
an area near settle was worst affected with 4,700 homes cut off on tuesday evening , but the company says there were other problems in cumbria and lancashire .
the firm say much of the damage was done by branches and other debris being blown into equipment .

documents.title: city 's troubled school is making grade , say inspectors
text: a carlisle school that 's been put in special measures twice says it 's now been rated `` good '' by inspectors .
richard rose central academy has been heavily criticised in the past for inadequate teaching standards , unruly pupils , and poor management .
it was taken over by a national organisation , united learning , in 2013 and came out of special measures two years later .
now the school says its latest ofsted report , which will be published tomorrow , shows it 's improved enough to be classed as good .

documents.title: three held after van driver robbed in wigton
text: three men have been arrested after a van driver was robbed at knifepoint in wigton .
it happened while the driver was parked in station road at about 05:30 this morning .
a bag was taken from the van ; police have n't said what was in it but say the contents were worth about £ 100 .

documents.title: bomb hoax caller is jailed for two years
text: a man who made threatening calls including a bomb hoax while on a drinking binge after leaving prison has been sent back into custody for two years .
andrew bell , 40 , threatened to harm police and himself as he made 999 calls from a phone box in central carlisle .
bell was in breach of an anti-social behaviour order ; he admitted that and two other breaches at carlisle crown court .
judge peter hughes qc said of the bomb threat : `` in the present climate in this country any such hoax has to be taken extremely seriously . ''

documents.title: pooch and pal go on show at grizedale
text: a photography exhibition which shows the bonds between dogs and their owners opens in the lake district today .
the by karen shepherdson have been taken at various locations in grizedale forest .
author: Kerry Parvin
Reporter

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : sunshine moving in
text: rain will ease later in the morning and skies will brighten up by afternoon .
there may be a few heavy and perhaps thundery showers , most likely on the lake district fells .
maximum temperature : 16c ( 61f )
one of cumbria 's best-known farmers , james rebanks , will be pleased .
you can find the latest weather forecast for where you are , here .
it 's bloody wet
it must be bad weather if a cumbrian says it 's bloody wet
ditto !
true
and green have a good day
it 's ok , i have new wellies .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : news crews scuffle outside kendal polling station
text: party leaders tend to get more than a little media attention on polling day .

the fleet street and tv `` pack '' apparently found it a bit of a squeeze as they tried to get a shot of the liberal democrat candidate for westmorland and lonsdale , tim farron , at a polling station .
it 's understood no one was hurt at the incident , which happened at a hotel being used for voting .

documents.title: washing the horses carries on after all at appleby
text: staff at eden district council say that river levels have not risen as much as expected , so the ramp down which horses are led to be washed at appleby horse fair , has not been closed after all .

documents.title: call for drug testing at all uk festivals
text: call for drug testing at all uk festivals
author: Michael Baggs
Newsbeat reporter

documents.title: water in the works stops talking newspaper
text: the talking version of the whitehaven news wo n't be available this week , for the first time in 25 years .
a leaky roof has flooded the paper 's office .

documents.title: chester sign barrow 's turnbull
text: chester sign barrow 's turnbull

documents.title: river ramp closed at appleby as eden rises
text: and within minutes of us posting the story about how the heavy rain might might make it unsafe for the traditional washing of horses at appleby fair , the ramp that 's used to lead animals down from the sands has been closed .

robin hooper , who chairs the co-ordinating group for the fair , said : `` the continued level of rain in the appleby area means the level of water in the river and the water temperature could be a safety risk to animals and people .
`` we are continuously monitoring the river levels and ask people not to bring their horses into the sands area of appleby for washing if the river ramp is closed .
`` we will assess the river level again at 09:00 on friday . ''

documents.title: community helps archeologists save copper mine heritage
text: volunteers are helping consolidate the remains of the copper-mining industry brought to the fells around coniston in elizabethan times .
peter marshall has been seeing the work in progress .

documents.title: rising river may mar horse fair tradition
text: appleby horse fair , said to be europe 's largest gathering of gypsies and travellers , starts today , drawing thousands of people to the traditional areas of the town such as fair hill and the flashing lane .

one of the event 's traditions , when horses are ridden into the river eden in the centre of the town for washing , may be disrupted this year if heavy rain today brings water levels back up ; the ramp into the river was closed until yesterday afternoon .
it 's something gypsies have been doing for centuries and it 's also part of the tourist attraction , but we do n't want it getting too deep where it 's actually going to be dangerous . ''

documents.title: test results at festivals 'prompted music fans to ditch drugs '
text: drug testing pilots at two music festivals last year , one of which was kendal calling , prompted almost one in five users to to dispose of their drugs , according to new research .
hundreds of people at the cumbrian festival asked for their drugs to be tested by the loop team at the lowther castle site last year , without risking police being involved .
details of the study will be published in the journal of the royal society for public health , which says testing facilities should be `` standard '' at future music festivals .

debbie pay , whose son christian died after taking a toxic substance sold as mdma at kendal calling two years ago , says : `` no parent in the world will ever think that their child will take drugs , but if they do they would like to think that they would be sensible enough to have them tested first . ''

we urge events companies to make these facilities a standard part of the uk festival and clubbing landscape , and we urge both local and national police and public health authorities to provide the support that will enable this . ''

documents.title: £ 5,000 worth of cash , cigarettes and drink taken in alston burglary
text: police say drink , cigarettes and cash worth more than £ 5,000 were taken in one of two burglaries at garages in alston on the same night .
the break-ins happened in the small hours of monday morning at moredun garage and townfoot garage .
a white ford connect vehicle was seen in the area at the time and was found abandoned nearby .
detectives say they 'd like to hear from anyone who has cctv near the two garages .

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : much better this afternoon
text: temperatures at 3,000 feet : 6c to 10c ;
winds : south or southwest gentle to fresh increasing near gale gusts 50mph by evening ;

cloud : extensive , often overcast , with bases at 1,000ft to to 1,960ft , lifting in the afternoon with the best of the conditions expected over the eastern and far eastern fells , well up to 3,000ft by evening ;
visibility : moderate , occasionally poor , with hill fog , becoming mostly good or very good in the afternoon ;
freezing level : above the tops .

documents.title: watch : climate change may have brought 'spooky web ' moth north to carlisle
text: these trees at eden golf club near carlisle have become covered with webs made by caterpillars .
climate change is thought to be one reason why the spindle ermine caterpillars have hatched there .
deb muscat from the cumbria biodiversity data centre says the insects are extending the northern limits of their range :
some of it might be related to climate change .
we are seeing more and more little creatures in cumbria that we have n't seen before .
the moths are are mainly found in the south of england , there have been some found in south cumbria , but not in this vast number and not covering so many trees . ''

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : a wet morning
text: it 'll start rather cloudy with outbreaks of rain which will become heavier and more persistent through the morning .
temperatures wo n't get higher than 17c ( 63f ) .
you can find the latest weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: 1,400 sellafield contractors take immediate industrial action
text: about 1,400 contractors have gone on immediate strike at sellafield .
author: North West Evening Mail
Newspaper

documents.title: polling opens for voters to make their mark
text: polling stations are open across the county for the general election , and voters will be able to make their choice until 22:00 this evening .

you can find out who 's standing , and other facts and figures about the county 's six constituencies on the bbc 's website : barrow and furness , carlisle , copeland , penrith and the border , westmorland and lonsdale , and workington .
if you 're a first time voter , there 's a complete guide to how to do it here .
we 'll have results overnight and through tomorrow .

documents.title: good morning and welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: we 'll be keeping pace with the news and the weather forecast and finding a few other items of interest from around the county through to about 18:00 .
if you have a photograph you 'd like to share , or you have news you think we should know , you can email us , tweet , or get in touch through our facebook page .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter
